title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
What is mWater?


mWater is a data collection, analysis, and visualization software platform. An entire water system can be mapped and managed down to the individual component level by mWater. Assets can be tracked; work can be planned and monitored. Maintenance issues can be reported and addressed.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
What is mWater?

Design flexible surveys online
Track geolocated Sites for collaborative, longitudinal monitoring
Collect data using Android, iOS, or a browser
Import and export data
Work in multiple languages
Use standard Indicators for the SDGs and more
Visualize and map your live data online
Scale up to thousands of users and millions of surveys

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Creating a mWater account

Go to Play Store and, using the following link, install the mWater

https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=co.mwater.clientapp&hl=en

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Creating a mWater account



STEP 1: Open the mWater Surveyor and click on Signup  



STEP 2: Enter your name, username, email address and a secret memorable password  



::: callout-important {style=“font-size:18px;”} Please check that your email address is correct before creating an account! :::

title: ipktpz.github.io
section: Logging in to verify your email
text:
Logging in to verify your email
STEP 3 Login with your username or your account’s email address.






Note


The app always checks for updates. If a new version is available, you might be asked to restart. Always press OK.

title: ipktpz.github.io
section: Logging in to verify your email
text:
Logging in to verify your email

When you first log in using your email, you will be asked to confirm the email you used to create the account.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Get the Latest Forms



Always press Sync Now on the Home page to make sure you have the latest version of every survey
You do not need to search for forms deployed to you - they will be automatically downloaded

title: ipktpz.github.io
text: Start a survey

title: ipktpz.github.io
text: Start a survey

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


Text: Enter text using the keyboard. Some text questions have multiple lines or may only accept certain formats like an email address.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


Date/time: Press the calendar to pick a date and time from a calendar. Use the arrows to navigate right and left on the calendar.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


Number questions: Select the keyboard to enter numerical data. Some questions are set to only accept decimal or whole numbers.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


Radio question: Choose one option from a list. This is best for options that have a short list of questions

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


Multi-check: Choose multiple options from a list.

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Basic question types


GPS/Location: Record GPS location where question was answered





Image(s): Use the camera or gallery to take one or more photo

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Naming and finding draft surveys
mWater automatically saves any survey that you start. If you leave the app and come back, it will be saved in the Draft Surveys tab.






Caution


Please check before deleting surveys, as they cannot be retrieved!

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Deleting a survey






Warning


Deleting a survey cannot be undone!

title: ipktpz.github.io
text:
Checking for data sync



Data upload includes form responses - mWater always syncs this data first



Image upload - photos are synced after survey responses



Cache Sync - downloads updated data from mWater servers to your device





Make sure sync is complete before working offline. Offline sync happens automatically every 20 minutes, and when you open the app.
